body: I'm having this exact issue. +1 please fix.
This issue remains in the fresh version 8.0.4.
Yep, It's the last GO that causes this. I just fixed it in my project by updating about a dozen sql scripts that were triggering this.

The problem is not the GO statement, it are the empty lines after the GO statement.

This issue started by this commit: https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/commit/9b8b38fa3f2fdc5c14dcf92453928cd38eb3dbc3#diff-c80a80f96194920fd36fd4daaa22d80408aaa7f083128172c4c05331f0b92de0
File: src/EFCore.SqlServer/Migrations/SqlServerMigrationsSqlGenerator.cs

Before that commit, empty lines were ignored so no new batch was created after the GO statement. Now after the GO statement a new batch is started but only contains empty lines which is the error.

Proposed solution: check wether the batch is empty before adding it to the builder (MigrationCommandListBuilder)
If this is a valid solution, I can have a look at it to solve it.

issue.title: Error in Generated Migration Script for Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer 8.0.4

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
## Error in Generated Migration Script for Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer 8.0.4
When generating migration scripts using this version, I have encountered an error in the structure of the generated script. The generated script appears as follows:

### Generated sql script

```SQL
IF NOT EXISTS (
    SELECT * FROM [__EFMigrationsHistory]
    WHERE [MigrationId] = N'xxxxxxxxxxxx'
)
BEGIN

END;
GO

```
The issue lies in the empty BEGIN and END block enclosed within the IF NOT EXISTS condition. This seems to be incorrect syntax and causes errors when executing the script.

### EF packages used
```C#
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design" Version="8.0.4" />
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer" Version="8.0.4" />
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Tools" Version="8.0.4" />
```
When we downgrade the Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer to version 8.0.2 the migration scripts are generated correctly.

### Expected Behavior:
The migration script generated by Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer 8.0.4 should have correct syntax without empty blocks, ensuring smooth execution without errors.

### Steps to Reproduce:
Example of migration used that produced this script:

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/assets/52384343/cfa770ee-6fae-44ca-be86-7166bf47adfe)
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/assets/52384343/cc687f65-7679-4a47-a474-39f272bc766b)

* Use Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer version 8.0.4.
* Generate migration scripts for a database.
* Observe the generated migration script.
### Provider and version information

EF Core version: 8.0.4
Database provider: (e.g. Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer)
Target framework: (e.g. .NET 8.0)
Operating system:
IDE: (e.g. Visual Studio 2022 17.8.5)
